intro: Scandix australis, commonly known as the Australian scurfpea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Scandix australis is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, which makes it an important plant in ecological restoration projects. Its seeds are also used as a food source by some native animals.
